timeline.message: consult other strategies if k8s can't provision the label

timeline.author: Vlatombe

timeline.message:
Revert "don't provision when containerCap is 0"

This reverts commit 9def9d2ad90b25f47dc9d0df91730dc9d33f6291.

Revert "test for zero"

This reverts commit 6ec488d38347a140d760037bcf5f3afa25edac20.

timeline.author: Vlatombe

replies.bodyText: Right, this is a better place to do the addition vs. modifying the method signature.
replies.author: schottsfired

timeline.author: Vlatombe
Vlatombe
Vlatombe

timeline.bodyText:
So the key change resides here. If the Kubernetes strategy did not provision any node through KubernetesCloud, it goes to the next strategy, allowing other clouds to pick up the request.
However as soon as it was able to provision at least 1 node using a KubernetesCloud, we consider this label isn't served by other clouds so we just end the provisioning to prevent the standard strategy from causing overprovisioning.
timeline.author: Vlatombe

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for noting! I should have documented this in the PR description but I am not very familiar with Jenkins provisioning logic.
If a label is served by multiple strategies, and the Kubernetes strategy serves the first N requests up to the concurrency limit, will the remaining requests eventually be served by other strategies?
replies.author: schottsfired

replies.bodyText: Not in the current round. If we reach the limit, on the next round, the Kubernetes strategy will provision 0 node and pass the ball to other strategies, however there won't be any more in-flight node because they get processed before each round of strategies (and the Kubernetes one returns instantly)
replies.author: Vlatombe
